results.title: A Collection of interactive work created by students (MAC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
Interactive works of the Graduate Diploma Students of Animation and Interactive Media at RMIT. The titles included are: ‘Haiku Dada’ - Felix Hude; ‘Arlecchino’ - Rosanna Morales; ‘Autograph’ - Mark Lycette; ‘Totally Rediculuos’ - Greg Zaritski; ‘Travels with cod’ - Gwyn Wethereld; ‘The Swear Club’ - Michael Buckley; ‘Equinox’ - Paul Western-Pittard.

results.title: Three Mile Creek (MAC)
results.creator_credit: Alyssa Rothwell and Department of Visual Communication, RMIT
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
This CD ROM is a collection of anecdotal accounts inspired by the experience of growing up in rural Australia. Music, dialogue and soundscape evoke the richness of the environment and create a sense of being there. A contemplative approach is the key to enjoying the stories. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Recommended for use on a Power MacIntosh with a minimum of 15MB free RAM.

results.title: Tales from the kangaroo's crypt (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: National Museum of Australia, University of New South Wales, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, The Riversleigh Society and Energee Entertainment
results.brief_description: This interactive CD-ROM takes you on a time-travelling mystery tour of the Australian fossil record from The PreCambrian Era 3500 million years ago, to the future in 2200 AD. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:MacIntosh: System 7, PC: Windows 3.1 or 95, optimised for 4X CD players.

results.title: Pals & Sals (PC)
results.brief_description: This CD ROM is designed for VCE language programmes in both primary and secondary settings. It contains excerpts of the 1996 PALS and SALS satellite broadcasts (as seen on Sofnet), and the materials contained meets Victorian LOTE CSF and VCE standards. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC that includes a 386SX or higher, at least 4MB of RAM, 2.5MB of available hard disk space, CD-ROM drive, audio board and VGA or VGA+. MS DOS and Microsoft Windows operating system version 3.1 or later.

results.title: Way back when (MAC)
results.creator_credit: Interactive Design Group, Board of Studies NSW
results.brief_description: This CD-ROM has been designed to allow Secondary level students to step back in time to Colonial Australia in a refreshingly new and interactive way. Structured for enquiry learning, students can explore hundreds of important aspects of colonial time through pictures, text, spoken word, poems and movies. Some of the issues covered include the reaction of indigenous Australians to Europeans, the legal system and how it changed, the changing roles of women and numerous aspects of the development of Australian society. Aimed at assisting teachers, this interactive tour would be a useful aid in the syllabus of English, Human Society and its Environment, Science and Technology, and Visual Arts. Minimum system requirements: 256-colour colour-capable Macintosh with 4 megabytes of RAM, running system 7 or later, with a CD-ROM player, a 12-inch 256 colour screen (on the LC) and a hard disk.

results.title: AIM graduate interactive collection of exemplary works 1992-2004
results.title_for_label: AIM graduate interactive collection of exemplary works 1992-2004

group_works.title: Memo
group_works.creator_credit: Jeremy Parker, David Atkinson and Matthew Riley

results.title: Three Mile Creek
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works selected by AIM director David Atkinson as representing the best interactive work produced by the AIM centre up until 2004. Three Mile Creek is a collection of anecdotal accounts inspired by an experience of growing up in rural northern NSW. The aim is to transport the participant into what is a distinctively Australian time and place, with the child who lives on the farm as their guide.
A contemplative approach is the key to appreciating the stories. Music, dialogue and soundscape evoke the richness of the environment and create the sense of being there

results.title: On the hop
results.brief_description: One of 6 works selected by AIM director David Atkinson as representing the best interactive work produced by the AIM centre up until 2004. A Kangaroo returns to her roots to discover how her other animal friends have fared since she’s been away. This handrawn interactive animation has great style and storytelling

group_siblings.title: Memo

results.title: Memo
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Parker, David Atkinson and Matthew Riley
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works selected by AIM director David Atkinson as representing the best interactive work produced by the AIM centre up until 2004. Memo is a journal-like collection of imagery, text and observations that looks at the permeation of the mediascape, technology and popular culture with the everyday. Intrigued by how this convergence shapes and influence what we perceive as self, experience, memory and identity I have examined and re-presented visual and verbal material derived from daily life-sounds, samples, imagery, text and language.
A subtle and very beautiful piece of interactive design and visual patina. Selected for exhibition at MILIA’s “New Talent Pavilion” 2001, Cannes, France.
